snippet: A disproportionate number of men who played at least five seasons in the N.F.L. from 1959 to 1988 developed Alzheimer's disease or Lou Gehrig's disease, according to a study released Wednesday.
abstract: A disproportionate number of men who played at least five seasons in the N.F.L. from 1959 to 1988 developed Alzheimer's disease or Lou Gehrig's disease, according to a study released Wednesday.

headline.main: Study Finds Increased Risks for N.F.L. Players
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Risk of Brain Disease for N.F.L. Players
